business.headline: Axis Bank shares drop 6% to hit 52-week low. Should you buy? Axis Bank share price: The stock closed at Rs 1,040.20 in the previous session, opened at Rs 1,006.95 on Friday and slid further to Rs 974.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

8th Pay Commission: What is fitment factor that determines salary hikeThe salary and pension hikes under the 8th Pay Commission will be calculated by applying the fitment factor to the existing basic pay.
Reliance share price rises over 2% after Q3 results. Should you buy now? Reliance's share price was up 1.44% to Rs 1,287 at 10:51 am on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Explained: Why Infosys share price tumbled over 5% after strong Q3 resultsInfosys stock was down 5.40% at Rs 1,822.10 on the BSE at 10:15 a.m. The company's shares had hit a day's low of Rs 1,815.85.

Sensex drops 750 points. Why did stock market fall in early trade?Stock market down today: The fall in IT stocks was a result of Infosys' shares falling over 5.3% after the company reported its Q3 results yesterday. The drop, however, came as a surprise as the company raised its revenue forecast.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Saif Ali Khan's narrow escape, knife missed spine by just 2 mm, say doctorsDoctors treating Saif Ali Khan on Friday said that the actor escaped narrowly as the knife missed his spine by just 2 millimeters.

Supreme Court pauses order directing rollout of Ayushman Bharat scheme in DelhiThe Supreme Court has paused a Delhi High Court order that directed the Delhi government to sign an agreement with the Centre for the rollout of Ayushman Bharat scheme in the national capital.

Saif Ali Khan attacker recced Shah Rukh Khan's house, cops suspect: SourcesSaif Ali Khan attack: The CCTV footage recovered from Shah Rukh Khan's house showed that the person's height and build closely resembles the suspect seen in the footage obtained from Saif's flat.

sports.headline: Watch: D Gukesh, Manu Bhaker receive Khel Ratna award from President Droupadi Murmu Olympic medallists Manu Bhaker, Harmanpreet Singh, Paralympian Praveen Kumar and world chess champion D Gukesh recieved the Khel Ratna Award, India's highest sporting honour, from President Droupadi Murmu on National Sports Day.

Meet Learner Tien: The teenager who stunned Medvedev in marathon clash Australian Open 2025: 19-year-old Learner Tien beat Daniil Medvedev in a thrilling five-setter that lasted four hours and 48 minutes. Tien got his name from his mother's profession as a maths teacher.

BCCI enforces strict rules on family travel, bans personal shoots during toursExclusive: The Indian cricket board has implemented strict rules for the senior men's national team following their Test series loss in Australia. In a 10-point guideline, accessed by India Today, the board has outlined restrictions on family travel, baggage allowances, and personal advertisement shoots.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
